content.description: Squat Start on 2 small/thin crimps. Smear a L-foot on the subtle tongue-ramp at the base of the wall and make a very delicate and high body tension stretch to a bad R-hand crimp/gaston. With terrible feet move out left to a slightly better crimp and either chunk to the lip or try and match and then throw to the lip. Originally was a hard 1-handed mantle press topout. Shoveling and brushing the topout would make the finish more manageable.
content.location: Starts on what looks like the best low starting holds on the wall.

content.description: Start matched on crimper mailbox slot and move left into the slanting sidepulls/gastons of 20/20.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the small over hang ~6' right of 20/20 in a crimper mailbox slot.

content.description: Stand start. Left Hand Undercling. Right hand side pull crimp. Feet on below the roof. Make a Right hand move to a small chip. Fire left hand to the jug.
content.location: Starts 3-4ft right of "Preservative Free Tears" and "Doctor's Orders"

content.description: Start under the roof and establish on the undercling. Move right to small side pull. Bump again to a 1/2 pad 2-finger divot, then go to the jug block at the top.
content.location: Starts under the small roof. Get feet on and establish before moving.

content.description: Start the same as "Pro-jectile" but make a giant move to the lip and topout.
Pull some Matrix moves out of your bag of tricks for this one.SDS on micro crimps. Pull On. Establish. Levitate to the "bigger" crimp in the middle of the face and end on "Pro-jectile".
content.location: Just a short distance up the small outcrop band (climber's right) of the main concentration of Creek Bed problems.

content.description: Start on the Mailbox Slot of PFT and go straight up using the slopey right side pull and a big throw.
SDS on a slopey slot and move L-hand to the good pocket then up to slopers, gaston or undercling, then slopey mantle in the nook and then top out. Same top out as Preservative Free Tears.
content.location: Sit start/squat start on the left side of the "best looking" rock

content.description: This outcrop runs along the Dam/Little Red River Access road. Very fine grained sandstone, sometime friable and can be wet for extended periods of time after any kind of precipitation. Climbing style is very technical and powerful on small crimp and bad feet.*Topouts were minimally established during first ascents and would benefit greatly from a shovel and some solid push-broom work on the tops
